== Introduction ==
The Communication Team will be responsible of:
# Spreading the word of Ubuntu GNOME
# Internal and External Communications between the team members and between the members and users of Ubuntu GNOME
# Administrating Ubuntu GNOME Social Media Sites
# Administrating Ubuntu GNOME Website

== Join Us ==
We are always looking for willing individuals to join the Ubuntu Gnome Marketing and Communications Team. Participants do not need to have any development skills but should have a passion to help spread the word about Ubuntu Gnome and its accomplishments on social media and in person. If you feel you are a fit, join our Launchpad Group and introduce yourself. Bilingual team members are a huge plus! <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntugnome-comms | Communications Team]]</nowiki> on Launchpad.

== Reports ==
The Ubuntu Gnome Marketing and Communications Team publishes a monthly report on community involvement. This report is public and will give users a retrospective view on the changes in community engagement. You are free to view this report on our <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuGNOME/CommunicationsTeam/Reports | Reports Page]]</nowiki>.

If you wish to view the legacy reports page, you may do so  <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuGNOME/CommunicationsTeam/April2014 | here]]</nowiki>.

== Our Channels ==
Connecting with the Ubuntu GNOME Team is Easy, Aside from our primary <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-gnome | Ubuntu Gnome Mailing List]]</nowiki>/<nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu-gnome | Launchpad Group]]</nowiki> we are also active on various popular social media sites. Please feel free to follow us for the latest.
